feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 8:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Thursday and Thursday Night... Snowfall and gusty winds between 20 and 30 mph will develop early Thursday morning and persist into Thursday night, resulting in localized areas of blowing snow, especially over higher terrain. Snowfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches can be expected. Conditions are expected to improve Friday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Upper Chena River Valley; Yukon Flats

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 18 at 8:41PM AKDT until October 20 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations one to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits. * WHEN...From 6 AM Thursday to 4 AM AKDT Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued October 18 at 3:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Near The Ward Lake Recreational Area. * WHEN...Until 730 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ketchikan Gateway Borough

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 18 at 2:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Central Inner Channels. This includes the city of Juneau. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 18 at 2:13PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 1:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Through Friday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1.5 feet above the normal high tide is expected along the Chukchi Sea coast, including Kotzebue Sound and north-facing coasts of the Seward Peninsula. North to northwesterly winds will increase today to 30 to 40 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas of the Chukchi
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref

entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Thursday and Thursday Night... Snowfall and gusty winds between 20 and 30 mph will develop Thursday morning and persist into Thursday night, resulting in localized areas of blowing snow, especially over summits of the Dalton and Steese highways. Snowfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches can be expected. Conditions are expected to improve Friday

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 1:45PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Tonight Through Friday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1 foot above the normal high tide is expected along the western Arctic coast from near Point Hope to Wainwright. North to northwesterly winds will increase today to 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas. Winds will gradually decrease
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 18 at 8:26PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to remain near or just below Moderate flood stage through midday on Thursday, then gradually fall through Minor flood stage into the weekend. For the St. Johns River...near Astor...Moderate flooding is forecast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia
